title: 107_hr3899
content: The "Seniors Mental Health Access Improvement Act of 2002" allows coverage of marriage and family therapist services and mental health counselor services under Part B of the Medicare program. The "Seniors Mental Health Access Improvement Act of 2002" expands Medicare coverage to include marriage and family therapist services and mental health counselor services. The "Seniors Mental Health Access Improvement Act of 2002" expands Medicare coverage to include marriage and family therapist services for the diagnosis and treatment of mental illnesses, provided by individuals with specific qualifications as defined by State law. The "Seniors Mental Health Access Improvement Act of 2002" expands Medicare coverage to include mental health counselor services for diagnosing and treating mental illnesses, performed by licensed individuals with specific qualifications as defined by State law. The "Seniors Mental Health Access Improvement Act of 2002" expands Medicare coverage to include mental health counselor services for diagnosing and treating mental illnesses, performed by licensed individuals with specific qualifications as defined by State law. The term 'mental health counselor' is defined as an individual with a master's or doctor's degree in mental health counseling or a related field, at least 2 years of supervised practice, and licensure or certification in states that provide for it. Payment provision under Medicare Part B is also addressed in the Act. The "Seniors Mental Health Access Improvement Act of 2002" expands Medicare coverage to include mental health counselor services for diagnosing and treating mental illnesses. The Act also includes a new clause for marriage and family therapist services, with payment provisions under Medicare Part B. The "Seniors Mental Health Access Improvement Act of 2002" expands Medicare coverage to include marriage and family therapist services and mental health counselor services, excluding them from the skilled nursing facility prospective payment system. The "Seniors Mental Health Access Improvement Act of 2002" expands Medicare coverage to include marriage and family therapist services and mental health counselor services in certain settings. The "Seniors Mental Health Access Improvement Act of 2002" expands Medicare coverage to include marriage and family therapist services and mental health counselor services in certain settings. The amendments allow marriage and family therapists to develop discharge plans for post-hospital services and authorize their services in hospice programs. Effective January 1, 2003, these changes will apply to services furnished after that date.
